history.content:
<md>The deal is that we want you to take 16B as soon as you can. Your strategy makes sense, and you will get in (assuming that we don't have some budgetary catastrophe). You may need to spend some time on the waitlist. Just don't delay any additional semesters because you don't want to take 16B.

There are no guarantees for enrollment into 16B after the end of sophomore year (for non-transfers). No seats are held for juniors.</md>

The deal is that we want you to take 16B as soon as you can. Your strategy makes sense, and you will get in (assuming that we don't have some budgetary catastrophe). You may need to spend some time on the waitlist. Just don't delay any additional semesters because you don't want to take 16B.

children.subject:
I have the same question^^ The only guaranteed path to graduating with a CS major as a sophomore who hasn't taken 16A yet seems to be to take both 16A and 16B next sem, while I still have priority. This is obviously ridiculous, but it seems to be the only choice EECS has left us. I wish the department had provided a buffer of 2 semesters for students to take 16A and B ASAP before just dropping this bombshell onto us. I wish they at least considered guaranteeing a summer offering so that we could take 16A knowing we can taken 16B in the summer. 

This just seems brutal.

Same... I legit had panic attacks in the past few days because of this. I never knew we HAD to take EE series before junior year. I have always been prioritizing 61a, b, and 70 so I could declare. Did not know that not doing EE16A/B on time would jeopardize my CS major. If so why not list that as a declaration requirement?? since if we do not do 16A/B on time we cannot graduate with the degree anyway lol

I am in the same situation. So technically we can still take 16B our junior fall, it's just that we might not get in to the course? If we enroll in Phase 1 will that guarantee admission? If I am declared CS then, will my chances of getting in be higher? I have heard mixed feedbacks and am a little confused. Some say that there is absolutely no chance of getting in 16B in junior year fall. thanks

history.content:
The other day, I saw this post on the 61B piazza, and I have a few questions.

I am a CS-Intended sophomore who is taking math 54 right now, I wanted to take eecs16a for the second semester and eecs16b during the fall of my junior year, but with the recent piazza post I linked above, I am concerned if that is still a possibility. It seems like sophomores who are yet to finish the 16 series are being put at a disadvantage. I understand that technically I can go straight into 16b after math 54 but I heard that that is a difficult transition so I wanted to take 16a to prepare for it first.

my questions are:

1) As a junior, would I automatically go on the waitlist and only be enrolled if there is space after adjustment period?

2) based on past fall semesters of 16b on Berkeleytime, it seems that there ended up being open seats at adjustment period, would this be an accurate representation of future semesters as well?

3) the eecs16b enrollment information says "A small number of seats will be held for second-year EECS and declared-CS students (including transfer students in their second year at Cal, even though they are seniors) until Phase II ends." does this mean that if I declare first, a small number of seats will be held as a junior, or is it supposed to read "second-year EECS and second-year declared-CS students"

Thanks in advance
history.subject: Question about EECS 16b enrollment
